entries.title: Perl White Camel 2012 awards announced
entries.text: At YAPC::NA David H. Adler (DHA) announced the names of the 2012 White Camel award recipients: Renee BÃ¤cker, Jim Keenan and Breno G. de Oliveira (aka garu). Please congratulate them!

entries.title: Promoting Perl to Dissimilar Users
entries.text: YAPC::NA was opened by the keynote of Michael Schwern talking about the lack of diversity in the Perl community. Especially among those who attend Perl workshops and conferences. chromatic taking the point to the techincal direction, suggesting we should make Perl easier for those who don't look like us.

entries.title: One of my most used and least understood perl snippets
entries.text: Manfred B. Perl shows a snippet to remove leading and trailing white spaces that generated 12 comments! Last time I saw a question about this there were  - I think - over 50 comment on LinkedIN. I think perl needs to have a trim function to eliminate all these repeated bike sheddings. (Actually the code in this blog is similar to what I show in class to point out why I prefer to use 2 simple regexes instead of one complex, and incorrect one.)

entries.title: YAPC::NA 2012: Mojolicious, swag, and pizzazz
entries.text: Glen Hinkle (tempire), whom I met only for a few seconds, has pictures of the swag you could get at YAPC, but he dislikes the name YAPC.

entries.title: YAPC::NA 2012  by scrottie
entries.text: scrottie is not a regular Perl blogger, so it was especially nice to see his writing about YAPC. I only wish he added a few more links to YAPC, some talks, the people he mentioned. That makes easier for the readers to further research and makes search engines happier.

entries.title: My First #YAPC
entries.text: Stephen Belcher has not been writing about Perl either and his opinion as a first-time YAPC attendee is interesting. He also has outgoing link :)

entries.title: My YAPC::NA 2012 notes and recap
entries.text: Andy Lester (petdance) has also described his experience on the Perl Buzz web site. He gave a very nice lightning talk about Ack 2 and then uploaded the first alpha version of it. In this post Andy describes the talks he attended in great detail. Very useful for people who could not attend them or who could, but need a reminder.

chapters.title: Events
chapters.header: I usually list the next 3-4 events here. The list of all the events can be found on on the web site. If your Perl event is not listed there, please let me know.
